 Source identification for the Log file.

Detailed Description

Socket class.

A class that provides low level access to the Berkeley sockets used in the framework.

Member Enumeration Documentation

Postcondition:

Returns:

char *  buf,
int  len,
uint  nSeconds,
bool  trace 
)

Receives an exact number of bytes from the peer application.

Parameters:
[in] socket : socket descritor
[out] buf : reception buffer
[in] len : number of bytes that must be received in this call
[in] nSeconds : number of seconds in which the buffer must arrive
[in] trace : whether to write a trace of the received bytes
Returns:
number of bytes received, or 0 if connection closed, or -1 if error or -2 if timeout

00245

00248          receivedLen =  0; // connection closed
00249          break;

00251

00254          int err = socket_error();

00256             continue;
00257          receivedLen =  -1; // error
00258          break;
00259       }
00260 
00261       // ok, got "len" bytes
00262       if (trace)
00263       {
00264          ushort port;
00265          struct sockaddr_in sa;
00266          socklen_t addrlen = sizeof(sa);
00267          char bufPort[50];
00268          getsockname(socket, (struct sockaddr*)&sa, &addrlen);
00269          port = htons(sa.sin_port);
00270          sprintf(bufPort, "received in port:%d", port);
00271          log_trace(bufPort, buf, len);
00272       }
00273 
00274       partialLenReceived += len; // for use by GenericClient
00275 
00276       pendingLen -= len;   // adjusts pending len
00277       receivedLen += len;  // adjusts received len so far
00278       buf += len;          // advances reception buffer
00279 
00280    } // while
00281 
00282    socket_setNonBlocking(socket, false);
00283    return receivedLen;
00284 }

Sends an exact number of bytes to the peer application.

Parameters:
[in] socket : socket descritor
[in] msgBuf : message buffer

[in] nSeconds : number of seconds to conclude the operation
[in] trace : whether to write a trace of the bytes sent
Returns:
number of bytes that were sent, or -1 if error, or -2 if timeout

) [private]

[in] socket : connected socket descriptor

Returns:
number of events available (-1, 0, 1)
